Protected Member Functions

  • void assertByteAligned () const
    Crashes if the bit functions of BitBuffer have been before using the byte functions without a previous call to BitBuffer::alignToByte.
  • void assertPositionAfter () const
    Crashes if the byte position is outside the buffer.

Protected Attributes

  • uint8 * m_buf
    The buffer itself.
  • uint32 m_bufSize
    The size of m_buf.
  • uint8 * m_pos
    The current position in the buffer.
  • bool m_selfAlloc
    True if the buffer is allocated within the DataBuffer.
  • bool m_bytesOK
    True if it is ok to write bytes.

Detailed Description

Superclass to the BitBuffer and DataBuffer.

Functionality that isn't needed in client has been removed.

Definition at line 27 of file SharedBuffer.h.

byte * SharedBuffer::getBufferAddress (   )  const [inline]
 

Get a pointer to the internal buffer.

This method could be dangerous if used in wrong way. The main reason to use this method is to write the buffer to a file descriptor.

Returns:
Pointer to the address of then buffer.

Definition at line 373 of file SharedBuffer.h.

Get the size of the buffer.

This is the maximum number of bytes that could be written into this buffer.

const byte* SharedBuffer::readNextByteArray (  int  dataLen  ) 
 

"Read" the next byte array from the buffer.

Does not copy anything, just returns a pointer and increases the internal position.

Warning:
Do not read other data than raw byte arrays with this method.
Parameters:
dataLen The length of the data.
Returns:
A pointer to the data array inside the buffer.

int SharedBuffer::readNextByteArray (  byte *  data,
int  dataLen
) 
 

Read the next byte array from the buffer.

Warning:
Do not read other data than raw byte arrays with this method.
Parameters:
data where to store the byte array.
dataLen number of bytes to read.
Returns:
number of bytes read.

uint8* SharedBuffer::release (   ) 
 

Releases memory used by this buffer, similar to std::auto_ptr::release().

The internal pointer will set to NULL and the size to zero, so fetch the size before using this. Use this instead of setSelfAlloc(bool).

void SharedBuffer::reset (   )  [inline]
 

Resets the offset.

Reimplemented in BitBuffer.

void SharedBuffer::setSelfAlloc (  bool  newVal  )  [inline]
 

"Dangerous" method that set the value of the membervariable selfAlloc.

This is used in the destructor to check if the buffer should be deleted or not!

Parameters:
newVal The new value of the selfAlloc membervariable.
